claim: The Great Wall of China can be seen from the Moon

supporting.text: The Great Wall of China is only about 30 feet wide, which is too narrow to be visible from the Moon with the naked eye.

attacks.text: The Great Wall of China is only about 30 feet wide, which is too narrow to be visible from the Moon with the naked eye.
The Great Wall is over 13,000 miles long, and its length could make it visible as a thin line from the Moon under certain lighting conditions.
Human vision cannot resolve objects as narrow as 30 feet from the Moon's distance, even if they are extremely long.
The contrast between the Great Wall and its surroundings might make it detectable from space, even if not clearly visible.
Satellite imagery and astronaut reports confirm that the Great Wall is not visible to the naked eye from the Moon.

supporting.text: Astronauts who have been to the Moon, including Neil Armstrong, have confirmed that the Great Wall is not visible from lunar orbit.

attacks.text: Astronauts who have been to the Moon, including Neil Armstrong, have confirmed that the Great Wall is not visible from lunar orbit.

Modern satellite imagery still does not show the Great Wall clearly from lunar distances, supporting the astronauts' claims.
